Alteplase.Definition: Human tissue plasminogen activator, purified, glycosylated, 527 residues purified from CHO cells Pharmacology: Activase binds to fibrin in a thrombus and converts the entrapped plasminogen to plasmin. It also produces limited conversion of plasminogen in the absence of fibrin. Mechanism of action: Cleaves the Arg-Val bond in plasminogen to produce active plasmin. Drug type: Approved. Biotech. Drug category: Thrombolytic Agents
